item.title: FBI Warns of HiatusRAT Attacks on Cameras, DVR Systems
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
FBI says HiatusRAT’s operators were seen scanning for web cameras and DVR systems affected by years-old vulnerabilities.

The post FBI Warns of HiatusRAT Attacks on Cameras, DVR Systems appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 16, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 16, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Texas Tech University Data Breach Impacts 1.4 Million People
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Texas Tech University says the personal, health, and financial information of 1.4 million was stolen from its health sciences centers.

The post Texas Tech University Data Breach Impacts 1.4 Million People appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CISA Warns of Exploited Adobe ColdFusion, Windows Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
CISA has warned organizations that two vulnerabilities affecting Adobe ColdFusion and Windows have been exploited in the wild. 

The post CISA Warns of Exploited Adobe ColdFusion, Windows Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Webinar Tomorrow: Navigating your OT Cybersecurity Journey: From Assessment to Implementation
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Learn how to develop a holistic solution that provides you and your team the power to mitigate cyber threats effectively within your OT environment.

The post Webinar Tomorrow: Navigating your OT Cybersecurity Journey: From Assessment to Implementation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Android Zero-Day Exploited in Spyware Campaigns, Amnesty International Points to Cellebrite
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Israeli forensics firm Cellebrite has been linked to an Android zero-day used to secretly install spyware on Serbian journalists' phones.

The post Android Zero-Day Exploited in Spyware Campaigns, Amnesty International Points to Cellebrite appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Arctic Wolf Buys Cylance for $160M Plus Stock From BlackBerry, Which Bought It for $1.4B
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Security operations firm Arctic Wolf has acquired Cylance from BlackBerry for $160 million in cash and 5.5 million common shares.

The post Arctic Wolf Buys Cylance for $160M Plus Stock From BlackBerry, Which Bought It for $1.4B appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Citrix Warns of Password Spraying Attacks Targeting NetScaler Appliances
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Citrix issues warning on password spraying attacks targeting NetScaler and NetScaler Gateway appliances deployed by organizations worldwide.

The post Citrix Warns of Password Spraying Attacks Targeting NetScaler Appliances appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Undocumented DrayTek Vulnerabilities Exploited to Hack Hundreds of Orgs
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Undocumented vulnerabilities in DrayTek devices were exploited in ransomware campaigns that compromised over 300 organizations.

The post Undocumented DrayTek Vulnerabilities Exploited to Hack Hundreds of Orgs appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Major Auto Parts Firm LKQ Hit by Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
LKQ, a major provider of auto parts, told the SEC that a recent cyberattack caused disruptions at a Canadian business unit.

The post Major Auto Parts Firm LKQ Hit by Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SRP Federal Credit Union Ransomware Attack Impacts 240,000
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
SRP Federal Credit Union says the personal information of 240,000 was stolen in a recent cyberattack claimed by a ransomware gang.

The post SRP Federal Credit Union Ransomware Attack Impacts 240,000 appeared first on SecurityWeek.
